choices.A: Configure the NVE interfaces to be Up on both switches.
choices.D: Configure the same VNI to multicast group maping.
choices.E: Set a different primary IP addresses on NVE source-interface.
choices.B: Set a different distributed gateway virtual MAC address.
choices.C: Set a different secondary IP addresses on NVE source-interface.

questions.question_text:
A vPC Type-1 inconsistency between two vPC peers in a VXLAN EVPN setup is discovered. Which two actions need to be attempted to resolve the issue?
(Choose two.)

discussion.content: This exam is ancient. Missing too many questions to count

Selected Answer: AD
A-D is right answer.
Went to exam yesterday, 50% of the questions were new, but if you have a clue of of what you are dealing with, you can pass with no problems.

Selected Answer: DE
VNI to multicast group mapping must be the same and different primary IP addresses on the NVE source interfaces are required. Answer is D and E

https://www.ciscolive.com/c/dam/r/ciscolive/emea/docs/2018/pdf/LTRDCT-3161.pdf page 33.
A, D is the correct answer.

comments.content: Hi, how was your exam? Have you passed? Is this Dump valid?

discussion.content:
D & E

VPC Peer must have
 Consistent VLAN to VN-seg mapping 
 Consistent NVE 1 binding to same loopback 
interface
 Same secondary IP
 Different Primary IP
 Consistent VNI to multicast group mapping

https://www.ciscolive.com/c/dam/r/ciscolive/emea/docs/2018/pdf/LTRDCT-3161.pdf

I think correct ED
-As a best practice when feature vPC is added or removed from a VTEP, the NVE interfaces on both the vPC primary and the vPC secondary should be shut before the change is made
- Consistent NVE1 binding to the same loopback interface (Using the same secondary IP address + Using different primary IP addresses)
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/switches/datacenter/nexus9000/sw/7-x/vxlan/configuration/guide/b_Cisco_Nexus_9000_Series_NX-OS_VXLAN_Configuration_Guide_7x/b_Cisco_Nexus_9000_Series_NX-OS_VXLAN_Configuration_Guide_7x_chapter_011.html

choices.A: Match the vPC domain ID between the two devices.
choices.D: Correct the configuration of the vPC peer link and the vPC peer keepalive.
choices.E: Configure one of the switches as primary for the vPC.
choices.B: Configure the IP address on the interface.

discussion.content: the answers are A and D

Selected Answer: AD
Keep alive is suspended
VPC domain mismatched on peers

The answer is A and C.

Check the networking in between the switches:
– Switch interconnecting in access VLAN mode, using the same VLAN for both Nexus switches.
– The VLAN is allowed across and between the switches.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/switches/datacenter/nexus5000/sw/troubleshooting/guide/N5K_Troubleshooting_Guide/n5K_ts_vpc.pdf

questions.question_text: A Cisco UCS C-Series Server powers off due to a power outage. The server should turn on when the power is restored with a fixed delay of 3 minutes. However, it remained powered off for more than 3 minutes after the engineer powered it back online. Which two actions resolve the issue? (Choose two.)

choices.B: Configure the power restore last-state policy.
choices.D: Set the delay fixed value to 3.

questions.question_text: A Cisco UCS B-Series Blade Server is configured to boot a VMware ESXi host from an EMC VNX storage array by using a Fibre Channel SAN. The boot order is confirmed to be configured as expected, but the server fails to boot from the SAN. Which action resolves the problem?

choices.D: Set the same WWPN pools for vHBA adapters.
choices.B: Set the boot LUN to the lowest LUN ID in the storage array.
choices.C: Set the same WWNN pools for vHBA adapters.
choices.A: Set the boot LUN to the highest LUN ID in the storage array.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Should be B

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. An engineer deploys a SAN environment with two interconnected Cisco MDS 9000 Series Switches. When the engineer attempts a zone merge, it fails with the error that is presented in the exhibit. Which action resolves the issue?

choices.D: Set the distribute policy of the zone to full.
choices.B: Change the name of one of the zones to match the other zone set.
choices.A: Import or export a zone set between the switches to synchronize the switches.
choices.C: Ensure that the zone members have different names.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Agree with the A

Selected Answer: A
A is the correct answer
